Detailed Description

Keeps track of the index of the images being received by the drain.

The drain instance shall encapsulate two counters, one for the RGB subscriber and one for the depth subscriber. Upon receiving a new image from the source, the subscriber thread will call Counter's updateSeq method and pass it the image's index. Counter will compare the current index with the previous index and calculate the number of lost images during transmission

Counter is thread safe.

Definition at line 25 of file counter.cpp.

void Counter::updateSeq ( unsigned long  index)

updateSeq

Everytime this method is called, loss will be updated based on the difference between current_seq and previous_seq.

Normally, this difference is expected to be 1, which means no loss between the arrival of two images/messages. In this case, loss does not change.

If the diff. > 1, at least one message is not received yet, and loss will increase.

Parameters
indexIndex of the newly received image/message

Definition at line 6 of file counter.cpp.

Member Data Documentation

boost::mutex helper::Counter::counter_mutex
private

Counter is designed to be accessible to the many subscriber threads managed by the drain. A mutex is essential to protect it against multi-thread conflicts

bool helper::Counter::first_time
private

If updateSeq is being called for the first time, this bool value would be true and prevent loss from being incremented
